## What is Quatro?

<br>
[Quarto](https://quarto.org/) is an open-source scientific and technical publishing system built on [Pandoc](https://pandoc.org/).

. . .

<br>
Quarto allows you create _dynamic documents_ which weave text and code together to produce documents, web pages, blog posts, books and more.

. . .

<br>
It is developed by [Posit](https://posit.co/) (formerly RStudio) and is considered the 'next-generation' of R Markdown

## How does Quarto work?

. . .

<br>
When using R Markdown, different packages are required for specific kinds of output:

. . .

- **Websites:** `distill` or `blogdown`
- **Books:** `bookdown`
- **Presentations:** `xaringan`

## How does Quarto work?

. . .

<br>
Quarto is an upgrade! It is a single publishing system for all sorts of output:

. . .

- Computations
- Documents
- Presentations
- Websites
- Books

. . .

Overview & Guides: [https://quarto.org/docs/guide/](https://quarto.org/docs/guide/)

## How does Quarto work?

. . .

<br>
Quarto works smoothly outside R & RStudio. The following programming languages can be executed:

. . .

- R
- Python
- Julia
- Observable JS

. . .

This also makes it suitable for multi-language computational work!

## How does Quarto work?

. . .

<br>
Quarto works smoothly outside R & RStudio. The following tools are supported:

. . .

- Command Line (Quarto CLI)
- RStudio IDE
- JupyterLab
- VS Code
- Neovim
- Text Editors
